text: I wouldn't want you to do exactly what I tell you, commander, and I hope to goodness they're going to start, we'd better light the candles.

passages.fragment: I would n't want you to do
passages.full_quote: But <used>I wouldn't want you to do</used> anything you don't want to.

passages.fragment: want you to do exactly what I tell you ,
passages.full_quote: I <used>want you to do exactly what I tell you, o</used>kay?

<used>I tell you, commander, i</used>t's true that some of the most terrible things in the world are done by people who think, genuinely think, that they're doing it for the best, especially if there is some god involved
"I didn't wish to interrupt <used>you, commander, and</used> as you say, you are in charge, but I was waiting until you said something I wanted to hear."
"You are a great man, <used>commander, and I hope</used> they put up a statue to you!"
He was bruised, but he was breathing<used>, and I hope to goodness</used> he sobers up

passages.fragment: I hope to goodness they 're going to
passages.full_quote: <used>I hope to goodness they're going to</used> give us a cooked breakfast.

"One minute it's all Is Truth Beauty and Is Beauty Truth, and Does a Falling Tree in the Forest Make a Sound if There's No one There to Hear It, and then just when you think <used>they're going to start</used> dribbling one of'em says, Incidentally, putting a thirty-foot parabolic reflector on a high place to shoot the rays of the sun at an enemy's ships would be a very interesting demonstration of optical principles," he added

passages.fragment: 're going to start , we 'd better light the candles .
passages.full_quote: "Anyway, if we'<used>re going to start, we'd better light the candles</used>."
